from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
import json
import calendar
from datetime import datetime, timedelta, date

import pandas as pd
from pyspark.sql.types import StringType,BooleanType,DateType,TimestampType,IntegerType, FloatType, StructType
from delta.tables import DeltaTable
import re
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, lit

spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
spark.conf.set("spark.databricks.delta.schema.autoMerge.enabled", "true")

storage_account=mssparkutils.notebook.run('/utils/py_utils_get_storage_account')
source_container_path = "abfss://odw-raw@"+storage_account

def ingest(definition, folder_path, filename, expected_from, expected_to):

    standardised_path = definition['Standardised_Path'] + "/"
    standardised_table_loc = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_account + definition['Standardised_Table_Definition']
    standardised_table_def_json = spark.read.text(standardised_table_loc, wholetext=True).first().value

    standardised_table_name = definition['Standardised_Table_Name']
    standardised_container = "abfss://odw-standardised@"+storage_account

    standardised_table_df = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
    rows = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == expected_from) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == expected_to)).count()

    ### check if the file has already been ingested
    if rows > 0 :
        logger.info("File has already been ingested")
        return

    jobId = mssparkutils.env.getJobId()
    ### mount the data lake storage in Synapse to the Synapse File Mount API
    mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/temp_raw") 
    mssparkutils.fs.mount( 
    folder_path, 
    "/temp_raw", 
    {"linkedService":"ls_storage"} 
    )   
    ### open .csv and .xlsx files using pandas
    if ".xlsx" in filename.lower():
        df = pd.read_excel(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", dtype=str)
    elif '.csv' in filename.lower():
        df = pd.read_csv(f"/synfs/{jobId}/temp_raw/{filename}", quotechar='"',escapechar='\\',encoding="utf8",dtype=str)
    else:
        raise RuntimeError(f"This file type for {filename} is unsupported")
    ### drop headerless columns
    df = df.loc[:, ~df.columns.str.contains('^Unnamed')]
    rows_raw = len(df.index)
    mssparkutils.fs.unmount("/temp_raw") 
    ### convert to pandas dataframe
    sparkDF=spark.createDataFrame(df)
    ### add date columns included with every standardised table
    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("ingested_datetime",lit(datetime.now()))
    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_from",lit(expected_from))
    sparkDF = sparkDF.withColumn("expected_to",lit(expected_to))

                    
    schema = StructType.fromJson(json.loads(standardised_table_def_json))
    
    ### remove characters that Delta can't allow in headers and add numbers to repeated column headers
    cols_orig = sparkDF.schema.names
    cols=[re.sub('[^0-9a-zA-Z]+', '_', i).lower() for i in cols_orig]
    cols=[colm.rstrip('_') for colm in cols]
    newlist = []
    for i, v in enumerate(cols):
        totalcount = cols.count(v)
        count = cols[:i].count(v)
        newlist.append(v + str(count + 1) if totalcount > 1 else v)
    for colix in range(len(cols_orig)):
        sparkDF = sparkDF.toDF(*newlist) 

    ### mappings for Json schema definitions to Pyspark data types
    mapping = {
        'string': StringType(),
        'timestamp': TimestampType(),
        'integer': IntegerType(),
        'date': DateType(),
        'float': FloatType()
    }

    ### writing the dataframe to the existing standardised table
    sparkDF.write.option("mergeSchema", "true").format("delta").mode("append").saveAsTable(f"odw_standardised_db.{standardised_table_name}")

    standardised_table_df_new = spark.read.format("delta").load(standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
    rows_new = standardised_table_df.filter((standardised_table_df.expected_from == expected_from) &  (standardised_table_df.expected_to == expected_to)).count()

    ### test correct number of rows have written
    if rows_raw == rows_new:
        logger.info('All rows have successfully written')

    ### delete transaction if incorrect number of rows has written and raise an error
    # else:
    #     deltaTable_standardised = DeltaTable.forPath(spark, standardised_container+standardised_path+standardised_table_name)
    #     fullHistoryDF = deltaTable_standardised.history()
    #     fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version']
    #     deltaTable_standardised.restoreToVersion(fullHistoryDF.select("version").first()['version'] - 1)
    #     raise RuntimeError(f"Incorrect number of rows have been written to the standardised table {standardised_table_name}, rolled back to original version")

history_files_source_path = f"{source_container_path}Fileshare/SAP_HR/HR/zSAP_HR history files/"


target_files_keys = ['absence', 'address', 'email', 'leaver', 'leave', 'pc', 'saphr', 'specialism']
# target_files_keys = ['saphr']
folders_to_ingest = ['2021-03', '2021-04', '2021-05']

folders = mssparkutils.fs.ls(history_files_source_path)
folders = [f for f in folders if f.isDir and f.name in folders_to_ingest]

# read orchestration data
path_to_orchestration_file = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_account+"orchestration/orchestration.json"
df = spark.read.option("multiline","true").json(path_to_orchestration_file)
definitions = json.loads(df.toJSON().first())['definitions']

for folder in folders:

    files = mssparkutils.fs.ls(folder.path)
    files = [f for f in files if f.isFile and f.name.lower().endswith('.xlsx')]
    for file in files:
        for key in target_files_keys:
            if key in file.name.lower():
                definition = next((d for d in definitions if key in d['Source_Filename_Start'].lower()), None)\

                if definition:
                    expected_from = datetime.strptime(folder.name, "%Y-%m")
                    expected_from = date(expected_from.year, expected_from.month, calendar.monthrange(expected_from.year, expected_from.month)[1])
                    expected_from = datetime.combine(expected_from, datetime.min.time())
                    expected_to = expected_from + timedelta(days=definition['Expected_Within_Weekdays']) 
                    
                    ingest(definition, folder.path, file.name, expected_from, expected_to)
                    break
